div.div: Upon graduation, Fall Mountain students will have the academic and social abilities to actively apply their knowledge and skills as ethically responsible citizens, well-equipped to succeed in their community, country and world.

nav.div: Fall Mountain Regional School District, SAU 60 » Departments » Food Services » School Closure Information

p.span: SAU 60 - Fall Mountain Regional School District School District
Office of Nutrition Program and Services

For the health and safety of our students and staff, Fall Mountain Regional School District will be closed for a three week period beginning Monday March 16, 2020. Our current plan is to reopen on Monday April 6, 2020. In order to help keep our students healthy, the Fall Mountain Regional School District is requesting permission to utilize the SFSP program COVID-19 emergency school closure rules to feed our students. The district is providing remote learning to all students during this time.

FMRSD is requesting approval to serve breakfast and lunch as pick up service at the attached locations and times, We are also seeking a waiver to the congregate meals service to allow meals to be consumed off site.
In addition, due to the remoteness of many of our families, we are requesting permission to use our school buses and drivers to deliver to these remote locations.
We are requesting permission to begin these services on Tuesday March 17, 2020.

Please also find menus for the Fall Mountain SFSP attached.
School Closure Cold Menu - Breakfast.pdf
School Closure Cold Menu - Lunch.pdf
Meal Delivery Schedule
Thank you for your consideration of this request.
SAU 60 - Fall Mountain Regional School District
Meals will be available for any child under the age of 18 at VMS, CMS, NCCS, and NWS daily. Meal times at all locations will be: 8:00am-12:30 pm.
